objectives: Describe the software development life-cycle
Describe the principles of structured programming and be able to describe, design, implement, and test structured programs using currently accepted methodology
Explain what an algorithm is and its importance in computer programming
content: Software life-cycle including design, development, styles, documentation, testing and maintenance
Program design tools and programming environments
Data types, variables, expressions, sequential processing
Algorithms including simple sorting and searching
Passing parameters by value and by reference
Principles of testing and designing test data

CS-119 (2022 Spring) - Python.name: Program Design & Development

c-id.Title: Introduction to Programming Concepts and Methodologies

objectives: Decompose problems and design program solutions using flowcharts, pseudocode, models, or other tools
Properly code applications using the fundamental coding structures: sequence, selection, and loops
Test and debug applications using debugging tools such as trace execution

COP2551 (2021 Spring) - Visual C#.name: Intermediate Object-Oriented Programming
objectives: Understand the program development cycle
Understand forms, controls, and events
Understand data types and variable scope
Use the various types of selection structures
Use the various types of repetition structures
Use arrays and pointers to store character and numeric data
Understand how to create and use functions
Understand how sequential data files are opened, read to and from, deleted, and merged
Understand the basic concepts of an object-oriented languages including inheritance, encapsulation, and polymorphism
Understand the basic concepts of working with a database
Understand the basic concepts of working with Language Integrated Query (LINQ)
